intro: Acinodendron pseudonervosum, commonly known as the false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. It produces small, clustered white or yellow flowers that are typically pollinated by insects. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
